Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
imo, one of the major issues is that most folks don't really understand where "stratum" ends and "a pool" begins, so it's all just a jumbled mess that needs to be redone from the ground up with no care or concept of the notion of "backwards compatibility" with s/z/k/nomp
And as I read that it makes me cringe that there are an ever growing number of letters to / as well as giving me a sense of deja vu

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
imo, we've really reached that point
initially my whole "we need an us thing" was mostly a "fuk ZEC/ZEN" thing, but we're honestly at the point where I think the level of "if"s in the trees is feken insane and the more we continue the worse it gets (including as you've pointed out several times that there are situations that the current libs *cannot* handle)

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes... exactly... My pool gets half way there... as long as everything uses equihash ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: With some way to verify the PoW with an RPC to the daemon ... It would be totally a standard that would litterally work with everything

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: dear god, I'm agreeing that we need to do things joker's way, the end is neigh 😲

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: As the equihash verify code in the nomp ... is just a copy paste of the code in the daemon.. does hte same thing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I just couldnt figure out how to connect them together at the time ... maybe I could do it now

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: well, eq verify is more about share counts and "fairness" in payments than anything else

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes... .which is why I couldnt work it out ...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I thaught it was just veriifying a found block...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but its not... That would be something I need help with, as Im not sure how it works or what exactly it does

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
the short answer is that it verifies that a share is a legitimate solution 
if yes, then share counts
if no, then miner gets no credit for the share

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: deep in the math there are shares that are "valid" but not legitimate 😕

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: so without it a "miner" could just send "fake" shares and get credit over and over

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I see my pool sometimes rejects shares from it, not sure if thats a miner problem though... my guess is that its a miner submiting an invliad share

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: So basically the RPC has to do equihashverify on a share?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: just return true or false?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as long as there wasnt too many flooding... it would be ok... but daemon RPC gets overloaded easily

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also needs a way to choose what hash algo to verify ... wihout just moving all the complexity to the daemon side

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: yeah, I think flooding was the reason they offset it to it's own executable, because the larger the pool the more demand that would put on the daemon

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`Also needs a way to choose what hash algo to verify ...`
that should be roughly "easy", the base is there already to support K,N and "networks", so in theory it would be just adding the new modules (obviously more in work than words, but in principle it should work)

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: OK, time to head up the hill and pretend that I want to be outside doing manual labor ☹

Content: lol...

Author: vulcan#5394
Content: @blackjok3r @dukeleto I've redone my knomp install and even rebooted so I've got a clean startup. No errors now, but no blocks found either. Beginning to think my copy of the blockchain might be corrupt. Is that a possibility, if so whats the best way to resync/reindex it ?

Author: vulcan#5394
Content: Btw Im hitting this server with 200kh/s, so i should be finding at least 1 block per hour of ZEX

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
that you haven't found a block does not mean there is an issue
your "expected" is an "on average" basis and only comes true over a long term
there are times where chickenpool has went 10+ hrs without finding a KMD block with double the hashrate as it had when it was finding 1 every 1-1.5 hrs
bad luck factually happens (I recall slush hitting a BTC block last year at like 2000x expected)

Author: Alright#0419
Content: can you show me what you have in `knomp/coins/ZEX.json`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: or whatever you named it

Author: Alright#0419
Content: did you start the daemon with `-pubkey`?

Author: vulcan#5394
Content: My komodod command line had -ac_pubkey= if thats the same thing. I'll post my json file in a sec

Author: Alright#0419
Content: it's not the same

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do `komodo-cli -ac_name=ZEX validateaddress $(komodo-cli -ac_name=ZEX getnewaddress)`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: take the `"pubkey"` from that and start the daemon with `-pubkey=<pubkey>`

Author: Alright#0419
Content: do not change ac_pubkey, you must leave that

Author: Alright#0419
Content: then in the `knomp/pool_configs/ZEX.json` file you must set the addresses to the address the pubkey is for

Author: Alright#0419
Content: the one shown in validateaddress output

Author: Alright#0419
Content: you need `"disablecb":  "true"` in the `knomp/coins/ZEX.json` as well
